trans-unit.source: !Note As with other depth-aware post effects, enabling ambient occlusion nullifies MSAA (multisample anti-aliasing).
trans-unit.target: !Note As with other depth-aware post effects, enabling ambient occlusion nullifies MSAA (multisample anti-aliasing).

trans-unit.source: Ambient occlusion darkens areas where light is occluded by opaque objects, such as corners and crevices. You can use it to add subtle realism to scenes.
trans-unit.target: Ambient occlusion darkens areas where light is occluded by opaque objects, such as corners and crevices. You can use it to add subtle realism to scenes.

trans-unit.source: The number of pixels sampled to determine how occluded a point is. Higher values reduce noise, but affect performance. Use with Blur count to find a balance between results and performance.
trans-unit.target: The number of pixels sampled to determine how occluded a point is. Higher values reduce noise, but affect performance. Use with Blur count to find a balance between results and performance.

trans-unit.source: Scales the sample radius. In most cases, 1 (no scaling) produces the most accurate result.
trans-unit.target: Scales the sample radius. In most cases, 1 (no scaling) produces the most accurate result.

trans-unit.source: The strength of the darkening effect in occluded areas
trans-unit.target: The strength of the darkening effect in occluded areas

trans-unit.source: The angle at which Stride considers an area of geometry an occluder. At high values, only narrow joins and crevices are considered occluders.
trans-unit.target: The angle at which Stride considers an area of geometry an occluder. At high values, only narrow joins and crevices are considered occluders.

trans-unit.source: Use with projection scale to control the radius of the occlusion effect
trans-unit.target: Use with projection scale to control the radius of the occlusion effect

trans-unit.source: The number of times the ambient occlusion image is blurred. Higher numbers reduce noise, but can produce artifacts.
trans-unit.target: The number of times the ambient occlusion image is blurred. Higher numbers reduce noise, but can produce artifacts.

trans-unit.source: How much the blur respects the depth differences of occluded areas. Lower numbers create more blur, but might blur unwanted areas (ie beyond occluded areas).
trans-unit.target: How much the blur respects the depth differences of occluded areas. Lower numbers create more blur, but might blur unwanted areas (ie beyond occluded areas).

trans-unit.source: The resolution the ambient occlusion is calculated at. The result is upscaled to the game resolution. Larger sizes produce better results but use more memory and affect performance.
trans-unit.target: The resolution the ambient occlusion is calculated at. The result is upscaled to the game resolution. Larger sizes produce better results but use more memory and affect performance.
